timelines.title: French Revolution
timelines.description: A period of far-reaching social and political upheaval in France from 1789 to 1799

timelines.title: Space Race
timelines.description: 20th-century competition between the Soviet Union and United States to achieve superior spaceflight capability

timelines.title: Industrial Revolution
timelines.description: The transition from hand production methods to machines and chemical manufacturing processes

timelines.title: World War II
timelines.description: A global war that lasted from 1939 to 1945, involving most of the world's nations

timelines.title: Renaissance
timelines.description: A period of cultural, artistic, political and economic rebirth following the Middle Ages

timelines.title: American Revolution
timelines.description: Political upheaval in which thirteen American colonies rejected British rule

timelines.title: Cold War
timelines.description: The geopolitical rivalry between the United States and the Soviet Union and their respective allies from 1947 to 1991.

timelines.title: World War I
timelines.description: A global war centered in Europe, lasting from 1914 to 1918.

timelines.title: Russian Revolution
timelines.description: The overthrow of the Tsarist autocracy and the rise of the Bolsheviks.

events.title: Storming of the Bastille
events.description: Revolutionary insurgents stormed and seized control of the medieval fortress, prison, and armory known as the Bastille
events.significance: Marked the beginning of the French Revolution

events.title: Reign of Terror
events.description: A period of state-sanctioned violence and mass executions during the French Revolution
events.significance: Radical phase of the revolution with widespread executions

events.title: Sputnik 1 Launch
events.description: The first artificial Earth satellite launched by the Soviet Union
events.significance: Started the Space Age and intensified the Cold War space competition

events.title: Apollo 11 Moon Landing
events.description: First crewed lunar landing mission with Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin
events.significance: First humans to walk on the Moon, achieving JFK's goal

events.title: Watt Steam Engine
events.description: James Watt's improved steam engine design revolutionized industry
events.significance: Powered the Industrial Revolution and transformed manufacturing

events.title: Attack on Pearl Harbor
events.description: Surprise military strike by Imperial Japanese Navy against the United States
events.significance: Led to United States entry into World War II

events.title: D-Day Normandy Landings
events.description: Allied invasion of Nazi-occupied Western Europe during World War II
events.significance: Opened Western Front and led to liberation of Western Europe

events.title: Mona Lisa Painted
events.description: Leonardo da Vinci painted his masterpiece portrait
events.significance: Epitome of Renaissance art and technique

events.title: Declaration of Independence
events.description: Thirteen American colonies declared independence from British rule
events.significance: Formal statement of American independence and democratic principles

events.title: Truman Doctrine
events.description: US President Truman announces a policy of providing economic and military aid to countries threatened by communism.

events.title: Formation of NATO
events.description: The North Atlantic Treaty Organization is formed, a military alliance of Western nations.

events.title: Soviet Atomic Bomb
events.description: The Soviet Union successfully tests its first atomic bomb, escalating the arms race.

events.title: Korean War
events.description: The Korean War begins, a proxy war between the US-led United Nations forces and communist North Korea.

events.title: Sputnik Launch
events.description: The Soviet Union launches Sputnik 1, the first artificial satellite, marking a significant advancement in Soviet space technology.

events.title: Cuban Missile Crisis
events.description: The Cuban Missile Crisis brings the world to the brink of nuclear war.

events.title: Apollo 11 Moon Landing
events.description: The United States lands the first humans on the Moon, a major victory in the Space Race.

events.title: Gorbachev's Reforms
events.description: Mikhail Gorbachev initiates political and economic reforms (Perestroika and Glasnost) in the Soviet Union.

events.title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
events.description: The Berlin Wall falls, symbolizing the end of the Cold War in Europe.

events.title: Dissolution of the Soviet Union
events.description: The Soviet Union collapses, officially ending the Cold War.

events.title: Assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand
events.description: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria-Hungary triggered a chain of events leading to war.

events.title: Outbreak of War
events.description: Austria-Hungary declares war on Serbia, and other European powers become involved, leading to a large-scale conflict.

events.title: Italy joins the Allied Powers
events.description: Italy joins the Allied forces against the Central Powers.

events.title: United States enters the war
events.description: The United States declares war on Germany, significantly impacting the balance of power.

events.title: Armistice signed
events.description: An armistice is signed, ending the fighting on the Western Front.

events.title: Treaty of Versailles
events.description: The Treaty of Versailles formally ends the war and imposes harsh terms on Germany.

events.title: February Revolution
events.description: Overthrow of the Tsar Nicholas II and the establishment of a Provisional Government.

events.title: October Revolution
events.description: The Bolsheviks, led by Vladimir Lenin, seized power from the Provisional Government.

events.title: Russian Civil War
events.description: A bloody conflict between the Bolsheviks (Reds) and their opponents (Whites).

events.title: Formation of the USSR
events.description: The creation of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics.
